titles.title: Shin Captain Tsubasa
新キャプテン翼
New Captain Tsubasa
新・キャプテン翼
Holly e Benji: Sfida al mondo

anime.description: Shin Captain Tsubasa takes place at the U-16 word cup in France. After some friendly matches in Germany, the underdog Japan has to face the world`s best teams. Will they make it to the top?

tag.name: association football
tag.description: Football is a sport that involves kicking a ball in order to score a goal, while the other team tries to stop you by kicking the ball in the other direction to score a goal of their own. In the United States, this sport is known as soccer; the inappropriately titled "American" football (which in fact is played with the egg-shaped "ball" being carried around) is some kind of rugby for babies.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: Weekly Shounen Jump
tag.description: The Weekly Shounen Jump is a Japanese manga magazine released on a weekly basis. Its main target audience consists of young males and it features several manga titles. The magazine was created by http://anidb.net/cr780 [Shueisha] in July, 1968, and was originally only called Shounen Jump, because it was not published every week at the time. A number of very famous shounen manga were or are published in it, such as http://anidb.net/a386 [Hokuto no Ken], http://anidb.net/a231 [Dragon Ball], http://anidb.net/a942 [City Hunter], http://anidb.net/a826 [Saint Seiya], http://anidb.net/a590 [Slam Dunk], http://anidb.net/a312 [Yuu Yuu Hakushou], http://anidb.net/a69 [One Piece], http://anidb.net/a239 [Naruto], http://anidb.net/a2369 [Bleach], http://anidb.net/a4563 [Death Note], http://anidb.net/a3468 [Gintama], to name a few of the most well-known.

character.name: Oozora Tsubasa
character.description: A prodigious soccer player, Tsubasa dreams of one day winning the FIFA World Cup for Japan. His position is midfielder, usually wearing jersey #10. (Wikipedia)

character.name: Wakabayashi Genzou
character.description: Wakabayashi Genzou is an extroardinary goalkeeper who can catch almost anything thrown at him. Not many shots can come past Genzou. A charismatic guy, Genzou is also loyal to his friends and he is firm with his decisions. Genzou always keeps his feelings to himself and people close to him as seen in Shin Captain Tsubasa, when he`s willingly criticize his teammates` performance in order to make them realize that football in Europe is different than what they play in Japan. His actions caused a lot of Japanese players to dislike him and Genzou only told Tsubasa his true intentions. From early childhood, he has aimed to be the best goalkeeper in the world. He tended to be selfish, and brag about his skills before he met and played a couple of games against Tsubasa. After his match against Tsubasa, he has learned to enjoy the game with his other teammates.

character.name: Hyuuga Kojirou
character.description: To help his family, Hyuuga Kojirou wants to be a professional player, an ace striker. His devotion to football and his persistence to shoot the goal is outstanding. He was both Tsubasa`s and Genzou`s top rival. A great guy, Hyuuga is not only strong, he is also tough but at the same time caring. Can be a bit impulsive at times, though. He was once famous because of his roughness and many players were scared of him. But, Hyuuga is actually a kind boy who cares about his family and friends. In the World Youth series, Hyuuga was one of the 7 players to be excluded from the Japanese National team after they lost 3 group matches with Real Japan 7 (R.J.7). Determined to get back into the team, Hyuuga developed a new shot, the Raijuu shot, a shot which is a bit similar to Tsubasa`s Drive Shoot, except that Hyuuga`s Raijuu Shot is a ground shot that will curve upward, unlike Tsubasa`s Drive Shooter which will go up then curve downward.

character.name: Wakashimazu Ken
character.description: The "Karate Keeper", Wakashimazu Ken is a goalkeeper on par with http://anidb.net/ch2084 [Wakabayashi Genzou], but more offense-oriented. As his nickname implies, he is an expert karateka since his father is the master of a dojo. His father originally disapproved his efforts to become a footballer and his opposition to become the heir of the dojo. Wakashimazu became interested in football when http://anidb.net/ch8344 [Hyuuga Kojirou] invited him to join the Meiwa team after being impressed by his abilities in a one-on-one duel that Wakashimazu lost. Since then, they are close friends. Despite being an excellent goalkeeper, he originally was a forward and only became goalkeeper because Meiwa didn`t have competent goalkeepers. A reliable partner of Hyuga while in the Meiwa and Toho teams, he and Wakabayashi regularly alternate in the goalkeeper position with the Japanese team.

character.name: Souda Makoto
character.description: Makoto Soda is a fearsome defender who knows how to injure people with tackles without the referee`s knowledge. He is quite fast and he tends to put effects on his balls when he passes or shoots.

character.name: Elle Sid Pierre
character.description: Midfielder and captain of the France national football team in the Captain Tsubasa series. His appearance and origin in http://anidb.net/a505 [the original anime] and related films is different from the manga and from the other anime adaptations since he appeared much later in the story of the manga.

character.name: Ramon Victorino
character.description: The captain of Uruguay in the Captain Tsubasa series. His first appearance in http://anidb.net/a3561 [Captain Tsubasa: Sekai Daikessen!! Jr. World Cup] differs from the manga and other adaptations as he hadn`t appeared in the canon story at that point.

character.name: Juan Diaz
character.description: A talented midfielder and captain or Argentina during the Captain Tsubasa series. His appearance in http://anidb.net/a3561 [Captain Tsubasa: Sekai Daikessen!! Jr. World Cup] is different from the manga and other anime adaptations since he hadn`t appeared in the canon story at that point.

character.name: Announcer
character.description: The ubiquitous voice that narrates most matches during the Captain Tsubasa series.

character.name: Jean
character.description: A French friend of http://anidb.net/ch30220 [Misaki Tarou].

character.name: Louis Napoleon
character.description: A boisterous French forward that plays with the French team in which he partners with http://anidb.net/ch98378 [Elle Sid Pierre] during the Captain Tsubasa series.

character.name: Gino Hernandez
character.description: Nicknamed "Perfect Keeper", Hernandez is the talented goalkeeper and captain of Italy during the Captain Tsubasa series. Later on, he becomes a good friend of http://anidb.net/ch43997 [Aoi Shingo] and plays an important role during the latter`s story arc.

character.name: Alan Pascal
character.description: A forward of Argentina and close partner of http://anidb.net/ch98537 [Juan Diaz] in the Captain Tsubasa series.

character.name: Galtoni
character.description: The goalkeeper of Argentina in the Captain Tsubasa series.

character.name: Galvan
character.description: A tall defender of Argentina in the Captain Tsubasa series.

character.name: Diego Barbas
character.description: The coach of Argentina in the Captain Tsubasa series. He is a good friend of http://anidb.net/ch30219 [Roberto Hongou]. At a certain point in the story, Barbas is interested in bringing http://anidb.net/ch2083 [Oozora Tsubasa] to the Argentinian football league in order to allow Tsubasa to grow to his full potential, which makes Roberto realize his mistake in leaving Tsubasa in Japan.

character.name: Deuter Muller
character.description: The giant and gifted goalkeeper of Germany in the Captain Tsubasa series. He is the manga counterpart of http://anidb.net/ch80225 [Hefner], who appeared first in anime adaptations prior to Müller first appearance in the original story.

character.name: Ramires
character.description: Assistant coach of http://anidb.net/ch30219 [Roberto Hongou]`s team that`s visiting France during the Jr. Youth Tournament story arc of the Captain Tsubasa series.

character.name: Franz Schester
character.description: A talented German midfielder who plays for Werder Bremen and the Germany national team in the Captain Tsubasa series.

character.name: Max
character.description: A midfielder that plays for Germany during the Captain Tsubasa series.

character.name: Mileus
character.description: A footballer that plays for Germany as a midfielder and later as a defender during the Captain Tsubasa series.

Defensa a sangre y fuego

決勝! 鋼鉄の巨人に挑め
Decisive Victory! Challenge the Steel Giant
Desafío al gigante de hierro
Kesshou! Koutetsu no Kyojin ni Idome
¡Finales! Reta al gigante de acero
追撃! 世界一が見えた?
Pursuit! Has the Number One in the World Seen This?
El camino hacia el campeonato mundial
Tsuigeki! Sekaiichi ga Mieta?
¡Persecución! ¿Viste al mejor del mundo?
翼よ翔け! 大空への誓い
Soar, Tsubasa! The Oath to the Great Skies
Alcanzar la cima
Tsubasa yo Habatake! Oozora e no Chikai

Presentation of characters in Shin Captain Tsubasa
